tools:
get_optimal_soil_moistures  
Retrieves the optimal soil moisture values in kPa or percentage above which to irrigate for all plots. 0 kPa means wet, 200 kPa means dry soil. In percentage: 0% means dry, 100% means wet. In percentage values, irrigate when below the optimum range.
faq:
Q: The moisture (kpa) is increasing slowly recently.
A: Need to check for current stage and evapotranspiration rate. If the crop is recently sown or pruning (छंटाई)  is done recently, the transpiration will be slow and moisture kpa will increase slowly. If evaporation is slow or temperature have dropped on rainfall has happened, it will increase slowly. The chatbot needs to check the temperature , rainfall and crop stage data. And advise if there is any reason for the slow increase.
If still there is some confusion, the chatbot needs to ask user to check moisture around the sensor by digging and then ask  the user if he wants to create an issue ticket for the same.

Q: What is the range of kpa moisture provided by the sensor ?
A: It's 0-200 Kpa. 0 kPa is wet, 200 kPa is dry

Q: What is my soil moisture depletion?
A: Soil moisture depletion %age = (100 - soil moisture %age)

Q: The moisture (kpa) is increasing very fast  recently and it is asking to irrigate frequently.
A:  Kpa is increasing fast it means that sensors are drying rapidly.  The chatbot needs to :
Check the actual kpa increase rate if it's higher now  in comparison to the previous weeks. If there no , tell the user that kPa increase is normal.
If there is rapid increase recently, check if the crop stag is near full fruit growth or harvesting. In the later stages , crop transpiration is very high , thus there is a rapid increase in soil moisture Kpa meaning decrease in moisture in the soil. Also, the moisture drop can be due to high evaporation recently. Check if there is temperature increase meaning high evaporation recently.
If the above two are not the cases, ask user to check the moisture physically near the sensor. If the actual moisture is wet near the sensor and the sensor is showing dry, the sensor might be worn out. In this case , ask if the user wants to raise a ticket with the support team.

Q: I irrigated still the sensor is dropping slowly.
A: Sometimes, the water reaches slowly till root zone and the moisture sensor kPa value drops slowly. Always wait for 12 hours after irrigation for the moisture to saturate. If still some confusion, ask user to check moisture near the sensor and check if he wants to raise a ticket for the issue.

faq:
Q: What is the range of kpa moisture provided by the sensor ?
A: It's 0-200 Kpa. 0 kPa is wet, 200 kPa is dry

Q: Sensor is showing wet, i.e. less kpa but soil looks dry.
A: The sensor measures the moisture around the rootzone which is not visible from the top. Ask use to check the moisture in rootzone around the sensor. If it matches, ask the user to irrigate.

Q: I irrigated still the sensor is dropping slowly.
A: Sometimes, the water reaches slowly till root zone and the moisture sensor kPa value drops slowly. Always wait for 12 hours after irrigation for the moisture to saturate. If still some confusion, ask user to check moisture near the sensor and check if he wants to raise a ticket for the issue.

Q: How do I know if my soil  moisture sensor is working fine ?
A: The only way to know is if after irrigation the sensor is dropping below 5 kpa and increasing continuously unless next irrigation is done. You can try putting water on the sensor and it should drop. Also, there should not be any fluctuations in the soil moisture data and the pressure kpa should always be increasing. Also, a soil moisture reading of 0 kPa is perfectly fine, meaning wet soil, but a reading of 200 kPa could mean fault. If the soil moisture sensor reading is consistently at 0 from few 48 hours, then it could be anamolous (use live and historical hourly soil moisture data (use tool) to validate).

Q: How to calibrate soil moisture sensors ?
A:  The way to calibrate sensors is by putting water on the sensor and it should drop. Also, there should not be any fluctuations in the soil moisture data and the pressure kpa should always be increasing. A drop after watering or irrigation and continuous dry upto 200 kpa means that the sensor is calibrated.

faq:
Q: How much to irrigate after receiving notification?
A: The net quantity of water to be applied depends on the moisture deficit in the soil, leaching requirement, and expectancy of rainfall. When no rainfall is expected and the soil is not saline, the net quantity equals the moisture deficit in the soil.

Q: When should I water? (Hindi: Paani kab dun?)
A: 0-5 kPa is wet, and increasing kPa means increasing dryness. The crop should stay in its optimal moisture zone, and when very close or above the dry optimal moisture, water can be given. Check internal irrigation forecast for the correct answer.

faq:
Q: How to calibrate soil moisture sensors ?
A:  The way to calibrate sensors is by putting water on the sensor and it should drop. Also, there should not be any fluctuations in the soil moisture data and the pressure kpa should always be increasing. A drop after watering or irrigation and continuous dry upto 200 kpa means that the sensor is calibrated.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor values fluctuate?
A: Ensure the sensor is installed properly in the soil, check for air bubbles, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor always shows wet values?
A: Verify the irrigation frequency, check the installation point, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

Q: I irrigated still the sensor is dropping slowly.
A: Sometimes, the water reaches slowly till root zone and the moisture sensor kPa value drops slowly. Always wait for 12 hours after irrigation for the moisture to saturate. If still some confusion, ask user to check moisture near the sensor and check if he wants to raise a ticket for the issue.

Q: How do I know if my soil  moisture sensor is working fine ?
A: The only way to know is if after irrigation the sensor is dropping below 5 kpa and increasing continuously unless next irrigation is done. You can try putting water on the sensor and it should drop. Also, there should not be any fluctuations in the soil moisture data and the pressure kpa should always be increasing. Also, a soil moisture reading of 0 kPa is perfectly fine, meaning wet soil, but a reading of 200 kPa could mean fault. If the soil moisture sensor reading is consistently at 0 from few 48 hours, then it could be anamolous (use live and historical hourly soil moisture data (use tool) to validate).

messages.content: Soil retention kadhaychi kashi
messages.en: How to remove soil retention
messages.standalone_question: How do you determine soil retention?
messages.standalone_en: How do you determine soil retention?

messages.content:
Soil retention काढण्यासाठी तुम्हाला खालील माहिती आवश्यक आहे:

1. **मातीचा प्रकार:** मातीची रचना (उदा. चिकणमाती, वाळू, लोम).
2. **मुळांची खोली:** पिकांच्या मुळांची खोली किती आहे.
3. **पाण्याची धारणा:** माती किती पाणी धारण करू शकते.

### Soil Retention काढण्याची पद्धत:

1. **मातीचा प्रकार:** 
   - चिकणमाती: 150-200 मिमी
   - लोम: 100-150 मिमी
   - वाळू: 50-100 मिमी

2. **मुळांची खोली:** 
   - पिकांच्या मुळांची खोली मोजा (उदा. 12 इंच, 18 इंच).

3. **पाण्याची धारणा:** 
   - मातीच्या प्रकारानुसार पाण्याची धारणा काढा.

### उदाहरण:
- जर तुमची माती चिकणमाती असेल आणि मुळांची खोली 18 इंच असेल, तर तुम्ही 170 मिमी (चिकणमातीसाठी) वापरू शकता.

तुमच्या प्लॉटसाठी soil retention काढण्यासाठी तुम्हाला मातीच्या विशिष्ट गुणधर्मांची माहिती असणे आवश्यक आहे. तुम्हाला याबाबत अधिक माहिती हवी आहे का?
messages.en:
You need the following information to remove soil retention:

1. **Soil type:** Soil composition (e.g., clay, sand, loam).
2. **Depth of roots:** What is the depth of roots of crops?
3. **Water retention:** How much water the soil can hold.

### Soil Retention Removal Method:

1. **Type of soil:** 
   - Clay: 150–200 mm
   - Lom: 100–150 mm
   - Sand: 50–100 mm

2. **Depth of roots:** 
   Measure the depth of crop roots (e.g., 12 inches, 18 inches).

3. **Water retention:** 
   - Water retention according to soil type.

### Example:
If your soil is clay and the depth of roots is 18 inches, you can use 170 mm (for clay).

To draw soil retention for your plot, you need to know the specific properties of the soil. Do you want to know more about this?

messages.standalone_question: What additional information do you need about calculating soil retention?
messages.standalone_en: What additional information do you need about calculating soil retention?

messages.content:
Soil retention काढण्यासाठी तुम्हाला खालील माहिती आवश्यक आहे:

### 1. मातीचा प्रकार:
- **चिकणमाती (Clay):** 150-200 मिमी
- **लोम (Loam):** 100-150 मिमी
- **वाळू (Sand):** 50-100 मिमी

### 2. मुळांची खोली:
- पिकांच्या मुळांची खोली मोजा. उदाहरणार्थ, जर तुमच्या पिकांची मुळांची खोली 12 इंच असेल, तर तुम्ही 12 इंच मोजा.

### 3. पाण्याची धारणा:
- मातीच्या प्रकारानुसार पाण्याची धारणा काढा. उदाहरणार्थ, चिकणमातीसाठी 170 मिमी वापरू शकता.

### 4. काढण्याची पद्धत:
- **फॉर्म्युला:** 
  \[
  \text{Soil Retention} = \text{Root Width} \times \text{Root Depth} \times \text{Soil Retention Value}
  \]

### उदाहरण:
- जर तुमची माती चिकणमाती असेल, मुळांची खोली 18 इंच असेल, आणि तुम्ही 170 मिमी वापरत असाल, तर तुम्ही खालीलप्रमाणे काढू शकता:
  - Root Width: 60 इंच
  - Root Depth: 18 इंच
  - Soil Retention: 170 मिमी

### पाण्याची आवश्यकता:
- जर तुम्हाला पाण्याची आवश्यकता असेल, तर तुम्ही पाण्याची मात्रा मोजण्यासाठी वरील माहिती वापरू शकता.

तुमच्या प्लॉटसाठी soil retention काढण्यासाठी तुम्हाला मातीच्या विशिष्ट गुणधर्मांची माहिती असणे आवश्यक आहे. तुम्हाला याबाबत अधिक माहिती हवी आहे का?
messages.en:
You need the following information to remove soil retention:

### 1. Type of soil:
- **Clay clay :** 150–200 mm
- **Loam(Loam):** 100–150 mm
- **Sand):** 50–100 mm

### 2. Depth of roots:
- Measure the depth of roots of crops. For example, if the depth of your crops' roots is 12 inches, you measure 12 inches.

### 3. Water perception:
- Water retention according to soil type. For example, you can use 170 mm for clay.

### 4. Method of removal:
- **Formula:** 
  \[
  \text{Soil Retention} = \text{Root Width} \times \text{Root Depth} \times \text{Soil Retention Value}
  \]

### Example:
If your soil is clay, roots are 18 inches deep, and you use 170 mm, you can remove as follows:
  - Root Width: 60 inches
  - Root Depth: 18 inches
  - Soil Retention: 170 mm

### Water needs:
If you need water, you can use the above information to measure the amount of water.

To draw soil retention for your plot, you need to know the specific properties of the soil. Do you want to know more about this?

faq:
Q: The moisture (kpa) is increasing slowly recently.
A: Need to check for current stage and evapotranspiration rate. If the crop is recently sown or pruning (छंटाई)  is done recently, the transpiration will be slow and moisture kpa will increase slowly. If evaporation is slow or temperature have dropped on rainfall has happened, it will increase slowly. The chatbot needs to check the temperature , rainfall and crop stage data. And advise if there is any reason for the slow increase.
If still there is some confusion, the chatbot needs to ask user to check moisture around the sensor by digging and then ask  the user if he wants to create an issue ticket for the same.

Q: The moisture (kpa) is increasing very fast  recently and it is asking to irrigate frequently.
A:  Kpa is increasing fast it means that sensors are drying rapidly.  The chatbot needs to :
Check the actual kpa increase rate if it's higher now  in comparison to the previous weeks. If there no , tell the user that kPa increase is normal.
If there is rapid increase recently, check if the crop stag is near full fruit growth or harvesting. In the later stages , crop transpiration is very high , thus there is a rapid increase in soil moisture Kpa meaning decrease in moisture in the soil. Also, the moisture drop can be due to high evaporation recently. Check if there is temperature increase meaning high evaporation recently.
If the above two are not the cases, ask user to check the moisture physically near the sensor. If the actual moisture is wet near the sensor and the sensor is showing dry, the sensor might be worn out. In this case , ask if the user wants to raise a ticket with the support team.

messages.content:
હા, તમારા ખેતરમાં ખાતર આપવાની જરૂર છે. હાલમાં, તમે "મસકમેલોન"ના વાવેતર માટે "વેજેટેટિવ ગ્રોથ" તબક્કામાં છો, જે 2 અઠવાડિયાના તબક્કામાં છે. 

આ અઠવાડિયે (28 માર્ચ 2025) માટે ખાતર આપવાની સૂચનાઓ:

1. **દિવસ 1 (28 માર્ચ)**:
   - **મેગ્નેશિયમ સલ્ફેટ**: 3 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર
   - **એમોનિયમ સલ્ફેટ**: 6.5 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર

2. **દિવસ 4 (31 માર્ચ)**:
   - **12-61-0**: 3 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર
   - અથવા
   - **24-24-0**: 3 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર અને **ફોસ્ફોરિક એસિડ 80%**: 2 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર
   - અથવા
   - **યુરિયા**: 1.5 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર અને **ફોસ્ફોરિક એસિડ 80%**: 3 કિલોગ્રામ/એકર

આ ખાતરો આપવાથી તમારા પાકની વૃદ્ધિમાં મદદ મળશે. જો તમને વધુ માહિતી જોઈએ તો મને જણાવો.
messages.en:
Yes, there is a need to give fertilizer to your farm. Currently, you are in the "vegetative growth" stage for the planting of "muscamalone", which is in the 2-week phase. 

Fertilizer giving instructions for this week (28 March 2025):

1. **Day 1 (March 28)**:
   **Magnesium sulfate**: 3 kg/acre
   **Ammonium sulfate**: 6.5 kg/acre

2. **Day 4 (March 31)**:
   * **12-61-0**: 3 kg/acre
   -or
   **24-24-0**: 3 kg/acre and **phosphoric acid 80%**: 2 kg/acre
   -or
   **Urea**: 1.5 kg/acre and **Phosphoric acid 80%**: 3 kg/acre

Giving these fertilizers will help in the growth of your crop. Let me know if you need more information.

faq:
Q: Do I need to spray?
A: Check the disease pest spray schedule for the farmer and reply accordingly. Don't check metrics, only pre-defined schedules to be checked.

Q: I already took spray for this pest, but it is still showing high prediction/chances, why?
A: Taking a spray does not affect the prediction calculation. If you have already sprayed based on the fyllo notification,
   then wait a few days, if the fyllo app still recommends spray, only then spray again. Don't give any other reasons.

Q: Can fungicide and insecticide be sprayed together?
A: For fungicides and insecticides to be sprayed together, it is important to consider factors like compatibility. For expert guidance tailored to your situation, we recommend reaching out to Fyllo’s CRM number for personalized advice.

messages.content: Sensor not working
messages.en: Sensor not working
messages.standalone_question: What should I do if the sensor is not working?
messages.standalone_en: What should I do if the sensor is not working?

faq:
Q: What should I do if the soil temperature sensor is not working?
A: Check the sensor connection, tighten it if loose, and restart the device to check updated data.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor always shows dry values?
A: Check if irrigation water is reaching the sensor, verify sensor connection, and ensure the sensor is not damaged.

Q: What should I do if the rain gauge is not working?
A: Open the top cover of the rainfall sensor and clean it as suggested in the maintenance section.

Q: How do I replace the sensors for Nero?
A: Disconnect the sensors by rotating them counterclockwise, unplug the connector, and replace them by following the steps in the manual.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor values fluctuate?
A: Ensure the sensor is installed properly in the soil, check for air bubbles, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

messages.content:
If your soil temperature sensor is not working, please follow these steps:

1. **Check the Sensor Connection**: Ensure that the sensor is properly connected. If it's loose, tighten it.

2. **Restart the Device**: Sometimes, a simple restart can help refresh the data.

3. **Inspect for Damage**: Check if the sensor is physically damaged or has any visible issues.

If the problem persists after these steps, consider contacting the Fyllo representative for further assistance.
messages.en:
If your soil temperature sensor is not working, please follow these steps:

1. **Check the Sensor Connection**: Ensure that the sensor is properly connected. If it's loose, tighten it.

3. **Inspect for Damage**: Check if the sensor is physically damaged or has any visible issues.

If the problem persists after these steps, consider contacting the Fyllo representative for further assistance.

messages.content: How to restart
messages.en: How to restart
messages.standalone_question: How do I restart the device?
messages.standalone_en: How do I restart the device?

messages.content:
To restart the Fyllo device (NERO_INFINITY_UNIT), follow these steps:

1. **Locate the Power Switch**: Find the switch below the top cap of the device.

2. **Turn Off the Device**: Press the switch to turn off the device.

3. **Wait a Moment**: Allow a few seconds for the device to fully power down.

4. **Turn On the Device**: Press the switch again to turn the device back on.

5. **Check for Data**: Wait for a few moments until the parameters on the home screen are visible.

If the issue persists after restarting, consider checking the connections or contacting customer support for further assistance.

faq:
Q: What diseases prediction does fyllo support?
A: Fyllo supports the following diseases:
    Alternaria, Alternaria Fruit Blotch, Alternaria blotch, Alternaria leaf blight,
    Anthracnose, Bacterial Blight, Bacterial Canker, Bacterial Spot, Blister blight, Botrytis mold, Brown Rust,
    Brown spot, Cercospora, Cercospora Leaf Spot, Cercospora leaf spot, Cigar end rot, Citrus scab, Colletotrichum, Damping off,
    Diplodia, Downy mildew, Early Blight, Fruit Canker, Fruit canker, Fusarium Wilt, Fusarium wilt, Graphiola leaf spot,
    Grey mold, Late Blight, Leaf Blight, Leaf Spot, Leaf spot, Marssonina blotch, Powdery Mildew, Powdery mildew,
    Purple blotch, Red rot, Rice blast, Root knot nematode, Rust, Scab, Sheath blight, Sigatoka leaf spot, Stylar End Rot,
    Whip smut, Xanthomonas, and Yellow Rust.

messages.content:
છબીમાં દર્શાવેલ પત્તા પર નુકસાનના નિશાન છે, જે કદાચ પેસ્ટ અથવા રોગના કારણે છે. પત્તાની વળાંક અને રંગમાં ફેરફાર લિપ માઇનર અથવા અન્ય પેસ્ટના હુમલાની સંકેત આપે છે.

મહત્વપૂર્ણ છે કે તમે નિયમિત રીતે પેસ્ટ અથવા રોગના નિશાન માટે નિરીક્ષણ કરો, અસરગ્રસ્ત પત્તાઓને દૂર કરો અને છોડની આરોગ્યને મજબૂત બનાવવા માટે યોગ્ય સિંચાઈ અને પોષણ વ્યવસ્થાપન જાળવો. જો સમસ્યા ચાલુ રહે, તો નિશ્ચિત ઉપચાર માટે સ્થાનિક કૃષિ નિષ્ણાત સાથે સંપર્ક કરવો યોગ્ય રહેશે.
messages.en:
There are damage marks on the leaf shown in the image, which is probably due to paste or disease. The change in the curve and color of the leaf indicates the attack of lip miner or other paste.

It is important that you regularly monitor for paste or disease marks, remove the affected leaves and maintain proper irrigation and nutrition management to strengthen the health of the plant. If the problem persists, it would be appropriate to contact a local agricultural expert for definitive treatment.

tools:
check_spray_conditions  
Gets the spray condition forecast for the next few hours for the farmer's plots and returns the condition for each hour as GOOD, MODERATE, or WORST, based on deltaT, VPD, and rainfall conditions.
faq:
Q: Do I need to spray?
A: Check the disease pest spray schedule for the farmer and reply accordingly. Don't check metrics, only pre-defined schedules to be checked.

Q: I already took spray for this pest, but it is still showing high prediction/chances, why?
A: Taking a spray does not affect the prediction calculation. If you have already sprayed based on the fyllo notification,
   then wait a few days, if the fyllo app still recommends spray, only then spray again. Don't give any other reasons.

Q: How much to irrigate after receiving notification?
A: The net quantity of water to be applied depends on the moisture deficit in the soil, leaching requirement, and expectancy of rainfall. When no rainfall is expected and the soil is not saline, the net quantity equals the moisture deficit in the soil.

faq:
Q: Do I need to spray?
A: Check the disease pest spray schedule for the farmer and reply accordingly. Don't check metrics, only pre-defined schedules to be checked.

Q: I already took spray for this pest, but it is still showing high prediction/chances, why?
A: Taking a spray does not affect the prediction calculation. If you have already sprayed based on the fyllo notification,
   then wait a few days, if the fyllo app still recommends spray, only then spray again. Don't give any other reasons.
